questions.answer: Understanding the ideological project and power dynamics at play.

questions.question: The speaker's discussion implies that applying post-structuralist theory to media analysis is most valuable as:
choices: A means of definitively proving the ideological intent behind media productions.
A framework for creating universally applicable interpretations of media content.
A method for simplifying complex media messages for easier public consumption.
A method for uncovering implicit biases and power structures within media texts.
questions.answer: A method for uncovering implicit biases and power structures within media texts.

questions.question: The speaker's concluding remarks primarily function to:
choices: Emphasize the necessity of quantifiable results in post-structuralist media studies.
Advocate for a more standardized approach to applying post-structuralist concepts.
Reframe the application of post-structuralist theory in media analysis as a heuristic rather than a rigid methodology.
Criticize the inherent subjectivity involved in post-structuralist interpretations.
questions.answer: Reframe the application of post-structuralist theory in media analysis as a heuristic rather than a rigid methodology.

questions.question: The speaker's use of phrases like "muddy the waters" and "critical excavation" suggests which of the following about the application of post-structuralism to media analysis?
choices: It is primarily a straightforward and objective process.
It is ultimately a futile exercise with no real value.
It is a potentially messy but ultimately revealing process.

questions.answer: It is a potentially messy but ultimately revealing process.

title: Chinese New Year
transcript: Chinese New Year is a very important holiday in China. Families come together to celebrate and eat lots of good food. Before the holiday, people clean their houses to get rid of bad luck. Red decorations are everywhere because red means good luck. Children often get red envelopes with money inside. On New Yearâ€™s Eve, everyone stays up late to welcome the new year. People also set off fireworks to scare away evil spirits. During the holiday, we visit relatives and friends to wish them good fortune. Itâ€™s a fun time of year filled with traditions and happiness.
